option.name: CONFIGURATION
option.comment: Node configuration type
Value: FE, BE, Prov-FE, CM, CS

option.name: ACTL_DB_USER_NAME
option.comment: Access Control DB User Name; it can be configured during new install. If it is changed later, the original data in Access Control DB will be lost

option.name: ACTL_DB_NAME
option.comment: Access Control DB Name; it can be configured during new install. If it is changed later, the original data in Access Control DB will be lost

option.name: PSWD_MUST_BE_CHECKED
option.comment: if NO no specific checks only password length is checked

option.name: PSWD_MIN_LENGTH
option.comment: minimum length of password

option.name: PSWD_MAX_LENGTH
option.comment: maximum length of password

option.name: PSWD_NBMIN_UPPERCASE_CHAR
option.comment: minimum number of uppercase characters

option.name: PSWD_NBMIN_LOWERCASE_CHAR
option.comment: minimum number of lowercase characters

option.name: PSWD_NBMIN_DIGITS
option.comment: minimum number of digits

option.name: PSWD_NBMIN_SPECIAL_CHAR
option.comment: minimum number of special characters

option.name: PSWD_CHECKED_AGAINST_DICT
option.comment: password checked against a dictionary

option.name: PSWD_DIFFERENT_FROM_USERNAME
option.comment: password different from user name

option.name: PSWD_USER_NBCHARSEQ
option.comment: Number of the maximum sequence of characters from the User Id with the range 0 to 10

option.name: PSWD_TWICE_CHARSEQ
option.comment: the password must not contain a sequence of 2 or more characters more than once

option.name: PSWD_REPEAT_USER
option.comment: the password must not be n repeat of the user ID (n >= 2)

option.name: PSWD_REVERSE_USER
option.comment: the password must not be the reverse of the user ID

option.name: PSWD_NB_SAME_CHAR_IN_ROW
option.comment: the password must not contain more than n of the same character in a row

option.name: PSWD_DIGIT_OR_SPECIAL_CHAR_NOTFIRST_NOTLAST
option.comment: the password must contain at least one number or special character but not in first or last position

option.name: PSWD_PASSWORD_SEQUENCE
option.comment: The password must neither contain repeating characters nor contain sequential digits or characters

option.name: PSWD_USERNAME_REVERSESEQ
option.comment: the password must not be a reverse of the user name nor contain a reverse of the user name

option.name: PSWD_OLDPSWD_NBCHARSEQ
option.comment: Number of characters allowed in sequence from the previous password, with a range 0 to 3

option.name: PSWD_REVERSE_OLDPSWD
option.comment: the password must not be a reverse of the previous password

option.name: PSWD_OLDPSWD_NBSAMECHARSAMEPLACE
option.comment: the password must not contain n or more same characters in the same position from the previous password

option.name: PSWD_WARNING_BEF_EXPIR
option.comment: a warning will be display before N days,it should less than the password max duration

option.name: PSWD_WARNING_PERIOD
option.comment: log periodicity during warning phase, it must less than the PSWD_WARNING_BEF_EXPIR value

option.name: PSWD_NBMIN_ALPHA_CHAR
option.comment: the min number of character password must contain

option.name: PSWD_CASE_SENSITIVE
option.comment: check against password and user case sensitive or not

option.name: AUTO_CLOSE_SESSION_FLAG
option.comment: auto close the session or not

option.name: SECONDS_BEFORE_CLOSING_SESSION
option.comment: this value indicate N seconds before auto close session when a user's state is locked

option.name: MESS_LOCK_FOR_UNSUCC_LOGIN
option.default_value: Continuous N times failed-login, your account now be locked
option.example: Continuous N times failed-login, your account now be locked
option.comment: message to print out on the GUI when continuous N times failed-login

option.name: MESS_LOCK_FOR_UNSUCC_LOGIN_FLAG
option.comment: YES/NO to indicate whether to print configured message MESS_LOCK_FOR_UNSUCC_LOGIN

option.name: MESS_LOGIN_WITH_LOCKED_USER
option.default_value: The account you login had been locked
option.example: The account you login had been locked
option.comment: message to print out on the GUI when login using a locked account

option.name: MESS_LOGIN_WITH_LOCKED_USER_FLAG
option.comment: YES/NO to indicate whether to print configured message MESS_LOGIN_WITH_LOCKED_USER

option.name: GLOBAL_ACTIVE_SESSION_NUMBER
option.comment: the default global active session number which will to used to limit the session number of user.

option.name: LOCK_INACTIVITY_ACCOUNT_TIMER
option.comment: defines the period (number of days) of inactivity of a user account from which the user is automatically locked. If 0, an inactive user will never be locked

option.name: LOG_INACTIVITY_ACCOUNT_TIMER
option.comment: defines the period (number of days) of inactivity of a user account from which an OAM log must be emitted. The value is the same for all users. If 0, no log will be emitted. Max value = 365

option.name: PSWD_HISTORY
option.comment: if NO : no history (new password may be identical to old passwords - except the last one), if YES : history (new password different from previous passwords ; the number of previous passwords is provided by PSWD_NB_LASTPSWD_SAVED parameter

option.name: ROOT_PSWD_MIN_DURATION
option.comment: For root user. minimum password aging interval between two password changes operation, from 0 to 24 hours

option.name: ROOT_PSWD_MAX_DURATION
option.comment: For root user.Password aging parameter from 1-120 which indicates the duration of the password is active from last modified date

option.name: ROOT_PSWD_NB_LASTPSWD_SAVED
option.comment: For root user. number of old passwords saved from 0-10

option.name: PREDEFINED_CONNECTION_ATTEMPTS
option.comment: predefined user account's max wrong-password-input number, or continuously retry number; if extend, user will be locked

option.name: PREDEFINED_MAX_SESSION_DURATION
option.comment: predefined user account's max session duration; if extend, session will be closed

option.name: PREDEFINED_AUTOMATIC_UNLOCKED
option.comment: whether server would automatic unlocked the locked user after a timer for these predefined user account

option.name: PREDEFINED_CONNECTION_TIME_OUT
option.comment: predefined user account's connection time out, after this expired, connection will be closed

option.name: LOCKED_ACCOUNT_AUTOMATICALLY_REACTIVATED
option.comment: indicates if a user account locked because of n unsuccessfull login attempts can be automatically reactivated or not

option.name: LOCKED_ACCOUNT_REACTIVATION_TIMER
option.comment: value of the reactivation timer (in minutes) - same value for all the users min value = 1 , max value = 1440 (24 h)

option.name: MAX_LOGIN_HISTORY
option.comment: defines the length of history that will be displayed when a user logs in (number of last successful and unsuccessful log attemps including date and time; min value = 0 , max value = 20; If 0, no history will be displayed

option.name: MVNO_MNGT_SUPPORTED
option.comment: if set to YES, the TOMIX NE allows Mobil Virtual Network Operator support (new parameter "userLabel" provided at user creation level) if set to NO, feature disabled

option.name: SANE_FEATURE
SAML_ARTIFACT_NAME
option.comment: SANE artifact name for HMI access

option.name: SANE_SESSION_TIMEOUT
option.comment: Time out interval when SANE session responds to request(in seconds)

option.name: SAML_RESPONDER_TIMEOUT
option.comment: SAML responder timeout in milliseconds

option.name: SAML_RESPONDER_NAME
option.comment: SAML responder service name to be used in UDDI query

option.name: OVERALL_SANE_TIME_LIMIT
option.comment: Overall time for SAML responder authentication in milliseconds

option.name: SAML_VALIDATE_ASSERTION
option.comment: validate SAML assertion (digital signatures) from SAML responder, only apply to https connection, should be disabled in http connection

option.name: SAML_VALIDATE_ASSERTION_CERT
option.comment: validate SAML certificate chain (digital signatures) from SAML responder, only apply to https connection, should be disabled in http connection

option.name: SAML_TRUSTED_STORE_PATH
option.comment: location of keystore file which contains CA certificates, javax.net.ssl.keyStore and javax.net.ssl.trustStore

option.name: SAML_TRUSTED_STORE_PASS
SAML_BASIC_LOGIN
option.comment: user name of basic access authentication in the request to SAML responder. If not null sets the Authorization HTTP header; if value is "none" means not used

option.name: SAML_BASIC_PASS
option.comment: password of basic access authentication in the request to SAML responder. If not null sets the Authorization HTTP header; if value is "none" means not used

option.name: SAML_USE_UDDI
option.comment: enable UDDI service querying

option.name: SAML_UDDI_DOMAIN
option.comment: domain name of UDDI query

option.name: SAML_UDDI_PROTOCOL
option.comment: Protocol to be used of UDDI query, http or https is available

option.name: SAML_UDDI_PORT
option.comment: port number of UDDI query

option.name: SAML_UDDI_PATH
option.comment: UDDI path used in constructing UDDI url

option.name: SAML_UDDI_CALL_TIMEOUT
option.comment: UDDI query timeout in milliseconds

option.name: SAML_UDDI_BASIC_LOGIN
option.comment: user name of basic access authentication in the request to UDDI query. If not null sets the Authorization HTTP header; if value is "none" means not used

option.name: SAML_UDDI_BASIC_PASS
option.comment: password of basic access authentication in the request to UDDI query. If not null sets the Authorization HTTP header; if value is "none" means not used

option.name: OAM_QUEUE_SIZE

0 means HSS closes diameter links without waiting.

option.comment: the timer interval for PDLSI to sample the G2-2 statistics info, in seconds

option.comment: the timer interval for PDLSI to write overload measurement into PSQL, in seconds

option.comment: The duration that stop polling Diameter queue when G2 internal resource happens
in milli-second granuality

option.name: REPLICATION_OVERLOAD_REGULATION_INHIBIT
option.comment: Disable regulation for replication overload type

option.name: READ_THREAD_LIMIT_PERCENT
option.comment: The read thread limit percent to trigger DB Access thread overload

option.name: WRITE_THREAD_LIMIT_PERCENT
option.comment: The write thread limit percent to trigger DB Access thread overload

option.name: DIAMETER_LOAD_BALANCER_NAME_1
option.comment: DIAMETER_LOAD_BALANCER_NAME_x is the names of the Diameter Load Balancer.
At most 4 Load Balancers would be used.
For filtering DIAM LoadBanlance's heart-beat LIR; Also used for diameter connection
lost alarm filtering. If a diameter connection is lost and the peer is diameter
load balancer, no alarm should be reported.
This is because diameter load balancer use a connection for heart beat and
the connection is created/closed very often.
if only ONE load balancer is used, the name must be set it to
'DIAMETER_LOAD_BALANCER_NAME_1'
if two load balancers are used, set to 'DIAMETER_LOAD_BALANCER_NAME_1' and
'DIAMETER_LOAD_BALANCER_NAME_2'
if three load balancers are used, set to 'DIAMETER_LOAD_BALANCER_NAME_1',
'DIAMETER_LOAD_BALANCER_NAME_2' and 'DIAMETER_LOAD_BALANCER_NAME_3'

option.name: MAXIMUM_NUMBER_OF_IMS_ALARMS_IN_CACHE
option.comment: The size of Alarm Cache, i.e. how many alarms can be cached for alarm timer
monitoring. If an alarm is raised and if the alarm need timer, then this
alarm should be stored in Alarm Cache and scaned by the alarm timer. If the
timer expires, the alarm is cleared and removed from Alarm Cache.
If the Alarm Cache is full, more Alarms are not stored in Alarm Cahce,
so Alarm Timer is not used for them.
If this parameter is not configured, 5000 is used.
If the configured value is less than 1000, then 1000 is used.
The maximum value for this parameter is 2^31 (int)

option.name: ALARM_MONITOR_INTERVAL
option.comment: the timer interval for monitoring alarm exipration by scaning alarm cache
in second granuality

option.name: DEFAULT_LOG_PRIORITY
option.comment: Default priority of OM log, allowed value:0,1,2,3,4,5

option.name: HSS_PNR_BATCH_TIME
option.comment: unit: ms

option.name: MPPR_MAX_TRANS_NUM
option.comment: The parallel transaction number

option.name: MPPR_MAX_MUD
option.comment: The Mass User Data AVP number in the PPR message

It used only for drop message due to BE overload.

the time to update BE overload log should be BE_OVLD_LOG_UPDATE_TIMER * delayBetweenRegulation
